channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Serious dip/ridge offside wheel, likely to cause accident, 1st August
item.description:
Location approx W3W ///kneeled.afterglow.securing, near layby, on downhill side of Cleeve Hill towards Winchcombe. Hit full on with offside wheels, like hitting a kerb. Very nasty ridge (as opposed to a pothole), difficult to see until you're on it.. As the motorcyclist says in the other report 5 days ago, it's bad. Annoyingly 1 week after I've paid to have my tracking done. Fri 1st Aug @ 2pm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road causing car damage, 1st August
item.description:
This road and the council representative has stated that it needs reporting to you the whole of Redding’s road from the prefabs onwards until the vets is very damaging and has caused many damages to cars also I understand that bus drivers have complained directly. When will this road be resurfaced as it’s a disgrace and the council member has passed the buck after 4 years of rows
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Reddings Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Area of 'parkland' neglected for several years, 1st August
item.description:
I have lived at 47 Appleton Way since 1991. The land opposite my home was tended by the council including a gang of men working for about a week to tidy the area and cut overgrown trees back to a sensible height. During 2024 on I think three occasions I reported to poor state of the area with no response. Today, 1/8/25 some helpful workmen arrived to clear brambles and bushes back. They had no instructions to tackle the main area. It would be nice if someone could inspect the area and formulate a plan to bring the area back to a more useable state.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
